revised_title: Effects of High Dose Rates of Ionizing Radiations on Iron and Cerium Salts Solutions
tldr: The authors studied the effects of high dose rates of ionizing radiation on solutions of iron and cerium salts. They found that the yield of ferric sulfate in the iron system decreased with increasing dose rate, while yields of hydrogen and hydrogen peroxide remained relatively constant. The results were interpreted based on inter-radical reactions that occur when reaction zones of neighboring clusters overlap.
